titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Kenneth Hugh De Courcy papers
titlestmt.author: Processed by Alistair Tough

publicationstmt.p: Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid created from paper document by Elizabeth Konzak. Date of source: 1984

titlepage.titleproper: Register of the Kenneth Hugh De Courcy papers
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 2007 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.abstract: Microfilm of correspondence, memoranda, depositions and other legal documents, minutes, and writings, relating to world politics, British foreign policy, espionage in Great Britain, the Imperial Policy Group, political views of the Duke of Windsor, and business affairs of and legal proceedings against British financier and publisher K. H. De Courcy.
did.langmaterial: Languages represented in the collection: English

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Kenneth Hugh De Courcy papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1979

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog Socrates at http://library.stanford.edu/webcat. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in Socrates is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

originalsloc.p: Originals in possession of: K. H. De Courcy.

chronitem.event: Honary Secretary, unoffical committee on Conservative Party policy, chairman Sir Reginald Banks
Member of the committee of the Exangelical Alliance which organized "crusades" by Billy Graham in Great Britain
Trial and convication for forgery and other offences
Chancellor, Order of the Three Orders

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Microfilm of correspondence, memoranda, depositions and other legal documents, minutes, and writings, relating to world politics, British foreign policy, espionage in Great Britain, the Imperial Policy Group, political views of the Duke of Windsor, and business affairs of and legal proceedings against British financier and publisher K. H. De Courcy.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged into six series: Imperial Policy Group, 1934-1942, Correspondence, 1936-1983, Correspondence with F. Roy Cattell, 1953-1957, Subject File, circa 1936-1984, Trial and appeals, 1946-1984, and Speeches and Writings, 1983-1984.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.

controlaccess.head: Subjects
controlaccess.subject: Espionage, Russian--Great Britain.
World politics.
controlaccess.famname: Edward VIII, King of Great Britain, 1894-1972.

scopecontent.p: Minutes of National Citizens' Union, and later Imperial Policy Group, committees and sub-committees with related reports and correspondence and other papers.

did.unittitle: Minutes of the National Citizens Union Policy Committee (which was reconstituted in October 1934 as the Imperial Policy Group) and of the Imperial Policy Group Executive Committee and sub-committees on: Empire; foreign policy; House of Lords reform; organization of propaganda; shipping; taxation; and unemployment,
Report of Foreign Affairs Mission on Central Europe with a covering letter to Sir Robert Vansittart,

scopecontent.p: (photocopy)

did.unittitle: Miscellaneous correspondence and other papers found in 1 above,

scopecontent.p: Correspondence of Kenneth De Courcy, arranged alphabetically by correspondent
Subjects include: British military strategy and preparedness; USSR strategy

Subjects include: British domestic politics; Federation of Rhodesia and Nyasaland; Field Marshall Bernard Montgomery; Near East; Rhodesia (Zimbabwe); Trade Union leaders' private talks with Conservative Party leaders; USSR foreign policy
Subjects include: East-West relations; Near East; Rhodesia (Zimbabwe)
Subjects include: possibility of recruiting opposition leaders to the Conservative Government (Clement Davies and Walter Citrine are named); Persia (Iran)

Subjects include: Afghanistan; British defense policy; British domestic politics; Near East; Poland; Rhodesia (Zimbabwe); South Africa; USSR. Also contains correspondence from Colonel R. Butler, "Chief of Staff" to General Walter Walker. (See also box 2 folder 6)
Concerns Roy De Groot, former circulation agent for Intelligence Digest in the USA
Subjects include: Conservative Party leadership; Eastern Mediterranean; Near East

Subjects include: Central African Federation; Conservative Party leadership; John F. Kennedy, President of the USA; Near East; Trade Union leaders' private talks with the Conservative Party leaders; USSR foreign policy

Subjects include: Czechoslovakia crisis, 1938; France, preparedness for war in late 1930s; Great Britain preparedness for war in late 1930s; Imperial Policy Group overseas propaganda; Kenneth De Courcy's complaints about M.I.5 interference with his mail and telephone; Kenneth De Courcy's attempts to become a conservative party candidate; Kenneth De Courcy's attempts to obtain exemption from "directed employment" under war-time regulations, World War, 1939-1945, possibility of a negotiated peace; World War, 1939-1945, Norway campaign
Subjects include: Central African Federation; conservative Party leadership; Suez crisis
Concerning war-time foreign policy and strategy, particularly in respect of air-power
Subjects include: Conservative Party organization and finance; evangelism as an anti-dote to socialism
Concerns infiltration of the Civil Service in Great Britain by Soviet sympathizers
Concerns infiltration of the Civil Service in Great Britain by Soviet sympathizers

did.unittitle: Walker, General Walter, and Burnand, P.,

scopecontent.p: Subjects include: Civil Assistance, an organization founded by General Walter to oppose subversion; attempts by the Ministry of Defense to restrict General Walter in the expression of his views on defense policy
Concerns Kenneth De Courcy's complaints regarding obstruction of his activities as a publicist
Concerns Kenneth De Courcy's complaints regarding harassment of Intelligence Digest by M.I.5

did.unittitle: Windsor, Duke of (King Edward VIII) and Duchess of (Mrs. Simpson),

scopecontent.p: Subjects include: abdication crisis; British domestic politics; British foreign policy; relations between the Duke of Windsor and his brother King George VI
Correspondence of Rev. F. Roy Cattell, Secretary of the Evangelical Alliance

did.unittitle: Correspondence of F. Roy Cattell as Secretary of the Evangelical Alliance,

scopecontent.p: Subjects include: Billy Graham's 1954 and 1955 British "Crusades"; politically accented reporting of the "Crusades" in Kenneth De Courcy's publications; suspected Communist sympathies of a member of the Evangelical Alliance committee
Notes, Correspondence, memoranda, reports and memoirs, arranged alphabetically by subject.

did.unittitle: Abuse of administrative power by civil and military authorities of Great Britain, complained of by Kenneth De Courcy's,

scopecontent.p: Correspondents include Lord Vansittart and Sir Anthony Eden
Correspondence and other papers re Michael De Courcy and alleged attempts by M.I.5 to penetrate Intelligence Digest through him

did.unittitle: France, foreign relations and military preparedness in 1938,
Prison memoirs of Kenneth De Courcy relating to Wormwood Scrubs Prison, London, Great Britain,

scopecontent.p: Contains reference to the escape of George Blake

did.unittitle: Subversive activities of Soviet sympathizers in the Civil Service of Great Britain,

scopecontent.p: aides-memoirs written by Kenneth De Courcy, dated 1936-1949 and apparently re-copied later

did.unittitle: Windsor, Duke of (King Edward VIII), copies of correspondence and various notes
Windsor, Duke of (King Edward VIII), correspondence and other papers,

scopecontent.p: Concerns allegations that the Duke considered committing treason by becoming a party to peace negotiations with Nazi Germany

Concerns many aspects of European and Near Eastern affairs including: Czechoslovakia crisis, 1938; Russo-German relations; World War, 1939-1945, Norway campaign; World War, 1939-1945, possibility of a negotiated pace. Correspondents include: General Brecard (France); H. A. Butler; Sir Eric Geddes; M. Leger (France); H. Lemery (France)
Consists almost entirely of copies of items in Folder 7 above, also contains a detailed report on the equipment and strength of the USSR Air Force, 1939

Intelligence reports concerning the foreign policy and military capacity of Estonia, Finland, Latvia, Lithuania, Norway, Poland and Sweden, prepared by Alastair Campbell on the basis of interviews, written materials, and travel in the countries named
diplomatic history, possibility of a negotiated peace, 1939-1940

Correspondence, memoranda, affidavits, company stock applications, contracts, powers of attorney, trust deeds, and related papers concerning Kenneth De Courcy's 1963-1964 trial and conviction and subsequent attempts to appeal against the conviction and to obtain publicity in respect of the case, also concerning property transitions in Canada and Rhodesia (Zimbabwe), arranged chronologically
Subversive activities of Soviet sympathizers in Great Britain, Kenneth De Courcy's opposition to subversion, and the circumstance of Kenneth De Courcy's trial

Trial counts 8 and 9: forgery in the form of issuing ante-dated documents. Other subjects include: Nassau anti-Communist conference organized by Kenneth De Courcy, 1962; proposed Art Digest and Bankers' Digest magazines; Rhodesia (Zimbabwe) property dealings

Trial count 4: falsification of Overseas Land Purchasing Trust records. Other subjects include: Rhodesia (Zimbabwe), politics and business, Salisbury, Rhodesia (Harare, Zimbabwe), housing construction
Trial counts 4 and 13: forgery. Other subject include Salisbury, Rhodesia (Harare, Zimbabwe) housing construction (1 of 2)
Trial counts 4 and 13: forgery. Other subject include Salisbury, Rhodesia (Harare, Zimbabwe) housing construction (2 of 2)
Stock application in respect of Sarsden Consolidated Properties Ltd. Of Toronto, Canada with related papers

Kenneth De Courcy's campaign to prove the complicity of the Police in a conspiracy to obtain a conviction against him, particularly by means of concealing documentary evidence. Other subjects include Sarsden Consolidated Properties of Toronto, Canada
Trial count 3: (improper relations between Overseas Land Purchasing Trust and Sarsden Properties Ltd.?)
Fraud involving Dollar Land Holdings Ltd.

Trial Count 9: forgery in the form of issuing ante-dating documents, concerns complex relations between Dollar Land Holdings ltd.; Overseas Land Purchasing Trust, Reserved Property Trust, Peter Von Dumreicher and Kenneth De Courcy
Trial counts 13, 14, and 16: perjury and contempt of court, concerns control of New Townships Ltd.
Forgery in the form of issuing ante-dated documents in respect of the Reserved Property Trust
Kenneth De Courcy's attempts to appeal against conviction and to obtain publicity in respect of his case
Evidence submitted to the Royal Commission on Criminal Procedure by Kenneth De Courcy
Questions submitted to Kenneth De Courcy by the Archivist of the Hoover Instituion on War, Revolution, and Peace with the former's replies
Memorandum by Kenneth De Courcy
Printed copies of a news-sheet and a booklet by Kenneth De Courcy

did.unittitle: A Watcher on the Threshold (Kenneth De Courcy?) The Carolingian Crown of France Kilbrittain Newspapers Ltd., Dublin, Ireland

scopecontent.p: Two letters to De Courcy

did.unittitle: Typewritten transcript of an interview of K. H. De Courcy conducted by Charles Palm,
Letters from John Straker to Sir Carl Aarvold, David Parsons, Nicholas Ridley, Margaret Thatcher, Sir Michael Havers,

scopecontent.p: relating to the trial of K. H. De Courcy

Correspondence between John Straker and the Lord Chancellor's Department, 1985-1986, relating to the trail; the Lord Chancellor's speech of welcome to the American Bar Association in Westminster on July 15, 1985; and a clipping relating to Lord Halisham, 1985

Carbon copy of John Straker's letter to the Private Secretary to the Lord Chancellor, dated 19 July 1986; and the 31 May 1986 issue of News of the World containing an article on the Jeremy Thorpe scandal
Correspondence, 1987, relating to the Duke of Windsor and to various aspects of British politics and society
Correspondence and writings, 1991, relating to Kenneth De Courcy's trial in 1963-1964
